meanings.definition: A sector that is part of a larger sector.
meanings.sent1: In the technology industry, software development and hardware manufacturing are two different subsectors.
meanings.sent2: The agriculture sector includes subsectors such as livestock farming and crop cultivation.
meanings.sent3: The subsectors of the toy industry were like colorful puzzle pieces fitting together.
meanings.sent4: Each subsector in the fashion world was a unique thread in the fabric of the entire industry.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the various subsectors of the economy felt like discovering hidden treasures within a vast landscape.

meanings.definition: A division or category within a larger group or sector.
meanings.sent1: The education sector comprises subsectors like primary schools and universities.
meanings.sent2: Within the field of medicine, subsectors include cardiology and pediatrics.
meanings.sent3: The subsectors of the music industry harmonized together like a symphony orchestra.
meanings.sent4: Each subsector in the tourism sector was a unique destination waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: Identifying the subsectors of the forest ecosystem was like uncovering hidden layers of a natural masterpiece.
